title: Moussaka
steps: Sprinkle eggplant slices with salt and let sit for 30 minutes to draw out moisture. Rinse and pat dry. Brush with olive oil and grill or bake at 200°C for 15 minutes until golden. Set aside.
Heat olive oil in a pan. Sauté onion and garlic until soft. Add ground meat and cook until browned, breaking it up as it cooks.
Add tomatoes, tomato paste, red wine, cinnamon, oregano, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 20 minutes until thickened. Set aside.

Make béchamel: Melt butter, add flour, and whisk for 2 minutes. Gradually add milk while whisking constantly until thick and smooth, about 8 minutes. Remove from heat, stir in egg yolks, Parmesan, nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). In a baking dish, layer half the eggplant, all the meat sauce, remaining eggplant, then pour béchamel over the top.
Bake for 45 minutes until golden and bubbling. Let rest for 15 minutes before serving. Moussaka should have distinct layers with creamy béchamel on top.

title: Greek Salad (Horiatiki)
steps: In a large bowl, combine tomato wedges, cucumber slices, red onion, and bell pepper.
Add Kalamata olives. Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar. Sprinkle with oregano, salt, and pepper.
Toss gently to combine. Place the block of feta cheese on top (traditional Greek salad doesn't crumble the feta).
Drizzle a little more olive oil over the feta. Serve immediately. The salad should be fresh, simple, and let the quality ingredients shine.

title: Chicken Souvlaki
ingredients: Pita bread, Tzatziki, Tomatoes, Onions, Lettuce
steps: Mix olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, paprika, salt, and pepper. Add chicken cubes and marinate for 2 hours or overnight.
Thread chicken onto skewers. Preheat grill to high heat.
Grill skewers for 12-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until chicken is cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve in warm pita bread with tzatziki sauce, tomatoes, onions, and lettuce. Souvlaki should be juicy, lemony, and smoky from the grill.

title: Baklava
steps: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F). Mix walnuts with cinnamon.
Brush a 9x13 baking dish with butter. Layer 8 sheets of phyllo, brushing each with melted butter.
Sprinkle with 1/3 of the nut mixture. Add 4 more phyllo sheets (buttering each), then nuts. Repeat. Top with 8 phyllo sheets, buttering each.
Cut into diamond shapes before baking. Bake for 50 minutes until golden and crisp.
Make syrup: Boil sugar, water, honey, vanilla, and lemon peel for 10 minutes. Remove lemon peel.
Pour hot syrup over warm baklava. Let cool completely (at least 4 hours) before serving. Baklava should be crispy, sweet, and nutty.

title: Tzatziki Sauce
steps: Grate cucumber and squeeze out excess liquid using a clean kitchen towel. This is crucial for thick tzatziki.
In a bowl, combine Greek yogurt, drained cucumber, minced garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, and dill.
Season with salt and pepper. Mix well.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour to let flavors meld. Serve with pita bread, grilled meats, or as a dip. Tzatziki should be thick, creamy, and refreshing.
